an1.219-234:1: (29) "Bhikkhus, the foremost of my bhikkhu disciples among those who are learned is Ānanda."[n.02] During the last twenty-five years of the Buddha’s life he served as the Buddha’s personal attendant. For a biographical account, seeNyanaponika and Hecker 2003, chap. 4. InTh 027, he claims that he learned 84,000 teachings: 82,000 from the Buddha and 2,000 from the bhikkhus.
